google_play_reviews.content: The player is pretty laggh compared to Findroid on higher quality videos. Other than that, pretty much like the desktop variant
Good
Completely useless. PC server is in the same room, yet videos stream to my phone like a slideshow. Can't use Plex anymore since it won't recognize my folders. On to the next alternative...
GREAT WOPRK
Works great, easy to set up and configure!

Unwatchable on phone tried out Findroid and the video plays fine with no stutter and lag but this app just lags and looks almost like a slide show than a video. Also found no way to control volume in the app itself.
Doesn't work

I've had it with this app. Although it's an amazing alternative to Plex it's useless most of the time. No media detected. Random movies recognised as who knows what. Media not recognised. Subtitles sometimes work sometimes they don't. Trailers almost never work. The media detection is garbage ü§Æ worst ever. I've tried everything and it doesn't recognise the media. I ain't renaming hundred of files just because an incompetent development didn't bother to add SIMPLE folder view!Thats all ai need!
This stupid android versions forgets the password any time you accidentally open it while in flight mode or no connection to the server, developers do something for god sake!
Great App. Works as per manufacturer's specifications. Each update is better.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your review!

google_play_reviews.content: I love using this app, but for some reason google likes to put "Deceptive site ahead" warning on my self-hosted jellyfin server. I don't mind it as I am the only one using the server, but the android app stops working because of it. If there is a way to turn off secure browsing for this app that would be great.
It's very useful app .All movies alive able on it
Good but need check out on the search üîç bar it's not that giving
Unable to seek through playback without audio and video desyncing by at least 3 to 4 seconds. Only thing that fixes it is restarting the video from the beginning. Was working fine a couple weeks ago.

The app does pretty well for playing movies but I find myself must often playing music in it and the Android Auto support leaves quite a bit to be desired. There's no option to shuffle if I start a playlist from my phone, I can't control playback through Android Auto, Android auto also doesn't seem to resume the last playlist that I was listening to when I get back in the car.

Have been using jellyfin for a year now, notice some of the audio content on 5.1 would bug out on Android app,(phone having only stereo) and would only play surround audio despite forcing stereo. Keep up the amazing work. Thank you!!
Crashes if you use VLC as external player

Absolutely great when it works. Definitely recommend getting it. Only minor issues as well: Sometimes video playback is very laggy and stutters when playing back on a S22 Ultra. Casting used to be pretty finecky and a previous update completely broke it. Now it's suddenly working again, but am unsure if there was an update or not that fixed it lol. However, this app is great, and once things are fully fleshed out for jellyfin as a whole, I'm sure this will be 5+ stars!
Good
Only plays video when the progress bar is displayed so basically when I'm touching the screen. So essentially not useable.

Its been working fine for me until all of a sudden. The audio will play but the video would freeze. Whenever i tap the screen, the video returns and when i keep tapping it, it works normally with the video and audio having no problem
google_play_reviews.replyContent: See https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin-android/issues/853 for more info on this issue.

google_play_reviews.content: Picture freezes on Android phone and tablet after a minute or 2 only sound playing cant use the app anymore as intended. Casting also broken loses connection after a while was an excellent app but not anymore
google_play_reviews.replyContent: See https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin-android/issues/853 for more info on this issue.

google_play_reviews.content: App works tho it has a issue with shuffled music and won't go to the next song once it has finished or the app will stop working in the background. Please fix these bufs! Also with the shuffling issue this as I have to manually press the button to go to the next song!
This app worked really good for a few years. Recent pixel 7 update makes play back slide show now.

Subtitling issue needs to be addressed (out of sync). The issue only occurs if you skip, fast forward or modifying playback. The issue also appears if you continue the last playback if unfinished. The issue only happens on android app as browser seems to be OK. Always have to watch from beginning without fast forwarding if want to keep the subtitles in sync.
Tried it as an alternative to plex. The app won't connect to my jellyfin server. Not user friendly at all unfortunately.

Update: letting it sit for a week fixed the slowness, I figured my library was the cause and it was, everything is loading fast after it had time to finish fully importing and doanloading metas. Great idea and was hoping this could be a good backup for plex, but maybe it's the size of my media library it takes way too long to load dashboard, and I can't get any videos to play using local connection to my computer.
Perfect.
Cant play half of my library. "This file cannot be played on this device, server isnt sending compatible format" really disappointing, despite a P2000 video card and nv hardware transcoding set up. @
Easy to configure. Running smoothly on ipad, pc and Android TV.
Good but could be better. Please add support for downloading subtitles on Android phones and TVs. It only works for computers as of now.
Subtitle timings are completely messed up, and only seem to get worse each time I try to increase the delay - Completely unwatchable. Desktop client with mpv-shim works extremely well though.

Really great alternative for plex, but facing major bugs and problems with web player,integrated player and external players. After selecting a video, it will play with that audio and subtitle automatically, it won't change. In general, can't choose audio or subtitles after the video starts.
I wish I can use it but I have a chromebook
Really Love this Application

Will not cast more than the first track of any album. Will show sonos as a device that it will cast to but will not actually send any audio to the sonos device. Doesn't seem like this app is supported at all.

Great or garbage depending on the device. I want to love Jellyfin but on the one place I really want to use this player app it's utterly unusable! That being on my FireSticks. Given its offered on the Amazon app store you'd think someone would have at least tested it, but clearly no one on the dev team has even run the app on a Firestick. It immediately is inaccessible because a battery settings requester pops up that you cannot access, completely locking you out! All you can do is exit.
This app is a blessing!
Still got some issues, but generally does exactly what I want. Also just had to add: app did not nag for a review. Which is partially why it got one.
Pls fix : custom made certificates for ssl makes the app unable to access server.

Buggy. Loses contact with server - sometimes you can reconnect without stopping the stream, sometimes not. Very unstable when casting to Chromecast - shows it's connected but will not communicate. Cannot control volume with volume keys on Android phone. Work in progress. When it works, it's great. When not, it's very frustrating.

Watching from my phone works just fine, but I really only use the app to cast to the Chromecasts in my home. I can always start something, but after a while the app will act like it's not connected anymore, and you can't just select the Chromecast and be good. So pausing, rewinding, or even stopping is pretty much impossible after you start. Live TV is really finicky too. Any disruption to the OTA signal and you have to select the channel all over again.
Love it
üëç

No resume, no fast-forward? I'm 80% through a 90 video, switch to mobile and it restarts at 0m(integrated). No option to get back to 75 minutes? Fast forward? Nope resume? Nope. Pretty major fail. Now my instance thinks I'm at 1 minute. Great. Love the platform on other devices. But these small glitches, here and there, basic glitches/limitations completely kill the experience for me. I'll keep trying to migrate in and will see if I can offer anything to the git, but right now. It's a struggle.

Continues to stop working. Has a tendency to freeze and skip, play with no sound or not work at all when starting a movies or show. Quite disappointed. Even streaming through my phone to the tv it freezes or doesn't work. App on the tv does not give me the option to select language prior to starting a stream. And if I select audio language whilst streaming it freezes and either resets or doesn't select the language. Pretty poor app. Fix the bugs it's frustrating when trying to watch something.
Works well. Nice project!

5 stars for the effort, it's amazing we get it for free. Needs some ironing out especially reproducing subtitled Transcoded content but I am sure they'll iron that out over time The windows app doesn't have these issues and provides an amazing experience

Wow what a pile of junk. I thought Plex was getting bad but this ball of fire is absolute trash. Works one day, next day I restart my pc which is the server and the jellyfin.exe file just disappears. I then reinstall the server and it doesn't recognise my libraries which means I have to wait hours for the scan to finish. Kicking this trash to the curb where it belongs
Why is there no option to download an album?
Poorly designed interface, having trouble to signed in. Going to uninstall now!

I'd give it 5 if was able to stream outside network. emailed development, used to have the same problems with Plex but works good now. i want to use jellyfin as their descriptions are better but need to keep Plex now due to this
can't hit play on live tv
thanks üëç ‚ù§Ô∏è HOWEVER , in android tv, need option to delete media and having a list view.
Jellyfin is great, but this client is extremely inconsistent; you'd be better off just using a web browser.
Worked fine for about 2 weeks. Now it won't connect to my server using my domain. Server accessible everywhere else. Thousands have the same issue. Rubbish app

Absolutely fantastic way to access and watch your content from basically anywhere. Fills my day with endless entertainment. Thank you. Could you guys work on a feature that shows you how many times you've watched something?
Worked well enough

I thought it's a browser issue but I have the same problems with the app. When playing music on DLNA speakers, there's no player bar (play, pause, next, previous etc) and no way to view queue. It only shows when playing to the phone itself. Unfortunate as it's so close to having the bare minimum to replace Roon for me.
Just discovered this app coming from plex. My question is how does this app has 4 stars. Should have 8. Keep up the great work.
It wont let me change download location

Edit.. it seems you need to cast from a Google app such as YT first, then a Google home option appears in Jellyfin. I was able to successfully cast and begin watching something. Will update review in 24 hours again after more use. Old Review - Can't cast to anything google based, unable to test further.
It works really well but lacking picture in picture while multitasking is an oversight.
Long between updates. No av1 playback on android tv.
It doesn't work with Chromecast. It will often fail to find my Chromecasts, and when it does it just doesn't connect to any of them. This app is useless to me.
Unreliable, inconsistent performance, continual freezing/buffering issues. A very finicky, overly sensetive, clumsy, and cumbersome app. Tried it for a few weeks, and it is just not worth the time.

After using tonido for years, I discovered the value of having a direct, unproxied connection to my media, after tonido turned off the tap. Since then I have worked with jellyfin, to try and get it working because it is invaluable as a decentralized tool. It took a lot of work, but I finally got my media to display as I wanted. [EDIT] But then I had to use tailscale because my ISP kills my connections after an hour. But now jellyfin works all the time, and I love it! Tailscale is great too!

There's absolutely no reason for the setup to be as painful as it is. I'm bout to ditch Jellyfin on smart tv over this. There's not even clear instructions anywhere on what I need to connect it. For god's sake, why is there Quick Connect for streaming sticks but not mobile? Even when you get it to work, its such a frustrating experience to get the correct metadata and images.

Please include pulldown to refresh feature. Also, need a button to deselect movie alphabet index, so that when we sort by ratings (for example), it will not be sorting only for that alphabet but for the entire movie database. The subtitle size is stuck at "small", changing to other sizes just doesn't get applied. Newly added videos are very slow to update. Subtitle can get out of sync if you pause, rewind or FF parts of the video.Seems the subtitle timeline moves independently after doing those.

The best platform, talking about jellyfin as a server and this client application. I like how good it is and better than any other app available. If you are even going to think what to choose from available alternatives, don't even question yourself, jellyfin is the choice. 7 out of 5
Uhh?? Opened the app and got prompted to 'Connect to Server'?? No info or help or link on what to do next?? Instant 0 star rating.
Great app works just like it says
Lifesaver, switched from Plex and it is a lot better. Metadata runs better!! The app could have the same UI as Plex to make it less confusing, but other than that it is nice

Thanks for the mini player info. The only other complaint I have (with the phone app specifically) is the difficulty I'm having getting access to my server when I not on my home wifi. I'll keep messing with it.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can switch to the integrated player in the client settings, which offers picture in picture support and gestures.

google_play_reviews.content: It's ok
Pleasantly surprised with Jellyfin as a whole, app works well

Problem! After I got Android 13 Jellyfin using VLC on client is not working! VLC work great with Nas and jellyfin to! But together not at all. Open jellyfin click on media then jellyfin closes down and I get to the phone's home screen!!

google_play_reviews.content: I would give it 5 stars if I could use this in "windowed" mode. The Hulu app does this feature well, and I think it's a very nice feature to have. google_play_reviews.content: worked just fine for years until we decided to push a bunch of updates to the server daemon for latest dotnet core. Now it gets stuck in unpredictable ways all the time navigating to shows and I can't even stream localhost from the web client.

The best manager you can get. I was a long time plex user and always hated how unstable it was. After 7 years it never really got any better. Jellyfin has about 80% of the features and a few bugs but light years more stable then plex.

It lags so much ... And its wired because the jelly fin tv works great on playback how ever its not made for hand held devices. If you someone can help with the issue. Ps audio works great just image has issues

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome app and product... Jellyfin helps organize your media and allows clients to stream it....and best of all its FREE. Thank you devs for all your hardwork!!!

google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can only use Jellyfin with a server hosted by yourself. You can install a server on your own computer for example. It's not possible to use the app standalone without a server.

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome Awesome Awesome
Damn good bro

Extremely well designed and straight forward app. Does what's expected and it works flawlessly with OnePlus 9 Pro, Chromecast, and Samsung Galaxy Tab S6 Lite. I'll go as far as to say it beats other streaming apps such as Netflix, Disney+, HBO or Prime, as this app have plenty of interesting features i.e Playback info, selectable bitrate/quality etc. I don't know programming so I can't contribute, but I will set up a subscription on OpenCollective.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app to host your own media server. This is definatly the best media server you can get and it is FREE. Would re omend for everyone to try. 1000/5 stars
Hosting done over my pc, works fine on multiple devices. Easy to setup. Works great

Have been using jelly fin for about 2 years. Never had an issue on the phone until this month. Stuff plays, but the picture freezes. Problem came out of nowhere. The audio is still going. If I tap my phone the picture catches up. If I tap my phone constantly there's no issue. As soon as I stop tapping, picture freezes again and audio continues. Anyone know a fix? It's working on all other devices still.
This app + mpv = GOAT

Really amazing work goes into this essential app but there's just so many frustrating bugs that never get fixed or are fixed only to break again in a future update. It makes me consider moving back to Plex. Many issues I have are with Chromecast; an essential feature of any media app that is sorely neglected in Jellyfin. One update breaks the function, it gets fixed only to break again a couple updates later. Other massive, time-wasting known issues continue to go ignored for months and years.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Chromecast works again in 2.4.4. Sorry for the hassle, it was an oversight in a recent change.

The problem is that the Android app only wraps the Jellyfin Web interface, and the code for the Chromecast integration isn't ideal.
Generally, the dev team for the app is quite small, so we have to put our focus on things that we see as most important.

google_play_reviews.content: After the update Chromecast speaker options have been removed. Can't play music on Chromecast speakers.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It's fixed now, please update to 2.4.4 to use Chromecast again.

google_play_reviews.content: I love this software, but it gets frustrating sometimes with integration. I caught my chromecast updating the other day and then subtitles stopped working. I tried updating jellyfin and now playback doesn't work entirely for chromecast because the cast button is unable to be selected due to overlap with phone soft keys that are now always present. I had to revert to a version from 2021. Irritating to say the least.
This app is godly, thank you devs!

No longer works at all on my phone. Works fine on Android TV, even on the phone browser, the app itself just doesn't connect to any server, all settings have been double-checked, retried, everything is being done correctly. No idea why this is happening. EDIT: Didn't change anything, but everything's working perfectly now. Thank you.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Could be an issue with your server setup. Please double check your SSL configuration if any, and report on GitHub so that we can help properly.

google_play_reviews.content: It just werks. People who are complaining that it crashes, not working or xyz do not know how to do basic troubleshooting. They either have an incompatible hardware without hardware acceleration, corrupted media file, unstable network or just paid plex shills. Jellyfin is superior because it's open source, stable and offers countless features other software don't. Big thanks to the devs!

Doesn't even play. Have to use the browser.

I give this app 5/5. Not only for this but also for the jellyfin server. Better exparience and privacy than plex.

After many years using plex, I have made the switch permanently with Jellyfin! Plex was always buffering which drove me nuts. If you paused a movie for too long, it would play for a few minutes and than require a reboot. Jellyfish is also a much nicer interface.

google_play_reviews.content: I've found that my jellyfin server version was not new enough for the updated client. I'm running docker container, using latest tag, and that only gave me 10.6.something. After changing the tag to unstable and redeploying, I'm at 10.8.0. This still didn't help with the black screen on my Android devices, until I force stopped the client, cleared cache, and deleted data. Afterward, restarting the app on my phone presented me with a server connect screen where I could log in and get to my content

google_play_reviews.content: It's pretty badly written. Constantly crashes, when you use Chromecast it randomly loses connection and/or forgets that it's casting (or forgets that it *isn't*), it doesn't work without internet, even if the server you want to connect to is in the local network and currently I can't even get it to start, it just shoes a blank gray screen. Works fine, thanks for exoplayer! Had to manually choose it though. Certain videos which transcoded before are now direct playing which is appreciated. Not sure about others complaining with an issue with the new android client, perhaps their server isn't running the minimum required version. All in all a great update.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! ExoPlayer still doesn't support all features from the web player, that's why it isn't the default (yet). But I'm happy to hear it works great for you!

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome app. Nice interface and user friendly.
Best
One of the best and easy to configure.
good

It's fine. Let's be honest. Most of us will watch our content on the TV. And the Chromecast functionality, believe it or not, is simply not good. When it shows up at all it works fine but half of the time the option isn't even available. Such a shame.
Crazy that this works. I can even cast to my Chromecast. Honestly the dopest thing, really impressed with the engineers.
I love this app

I really want to like this app. It's frustrating to see that we can't see our favorites for shows. I have favorited a bunch of them and there is no section to see them anywhere. Favs work for movies only. Can you fix this?
Love the app, but come on h.265
google_play_reviews.replyContent: H.265 is supported if you change to the integrated player in the client settings, that one isn't enabled by default however since it doesn't support all features yet.

google_play_reviews.content: In general it is good, but chromecast support is very unstable, so that's why 3
Very poor service and not opeartionabel
Love Jellyfin.
I would love it if casting worked consistently.

Jellyfin as a service and a program? Amazing, even when i do have issues its usually easy enough to fix myself. And the fact its free is amazing as well, nothing but respect for the devs This app? Usually decent, but subtitles tend to be really buggy for the app. And it makes watching alot of my shows a pain on my phone. Subtitles either have a hard time loading or load in the wrong order. If thats fixed id easily give a 5
When it works it's great. But sometimes It won't find the server or the app just displays a blank white screen.
Login method is for my phone is too complicated they need to make it simpler

Great alternative but still needs improvement. I use it for my private "Spotify" but there are a some points that need improvement in Android app: - variing bandwidth should be compensated by a configurable cache size, but atm if i.e. lte drops, music stops playing after the song - ui very slow - ui not usable for in car Entertainment - no android auto Support - when a call arrives on your playing device (phone) jellyfin stops and has to reload from scratch thanks for your effort!

Update: They fixed the issues and added option to listen to the audio in background and while screen off. AWESOME!!!! 5 Stars. Bye Bye Plex Old: Does not use external player even when selected. Only reason I want to use external is because every time I turn off phone screen, the internal player stops. Sometimes I just want to listen to the audio. Please fix external player or have option to run in background with screen off. Other that, some Playlist issues. Jellyfin is awesome though.
Tends to crash on my s9+ when playing music for a long time. I just use chrome browser.
I've only used this app for an hour and can tell you it's an amazing piece of software. It's indeed a home "Netflix"
Stutters when the app plays in the background
Inputs don't allow me to use saved passwords. Cannot select user on Android TV version. Need these bugs as it is a non-starter so far.
It's a great app I love it
Excellent app! Thank you Jellyfin team!
10.7.5 is still unstable. After refresh metadata, search for missing metadata, it deleted lots image metadata on my disk and replaced metadata with incorrect ones. Very disappointed.

I love my fileserver and open source software! The app definitely has a lot of bugs (locking the phone stops music streams, subtitles desyncs from video when fast forward/rewind sometimes, and downloads are messy), but for the most part it works great and fast and feels like a paid product. The sheer fact I have the ability to own and consolidate a media system without having to build or pay for it is incredible. I hope to contribute soon!
need amprove subtitle search
What is the host ? You mean vpn?
Works like a dream. Nothing else to say.

Takes some time and effort to set up the server side well, but the documentation available online is sufficient (although a youtube tutorial or two would be fantastic). I have had limited issues with using external players, but given this is an open source program it's totally understandable. Keep up the good work!! Edit: spelling
I was looking to replace plex, but this hasn't worked right once on my phone or chromecast ultra so far. It caused the chromecast to reboot. Tried x265, x264, vp9 encodings.
This app with a Jellyfin server is perfection. I replaced my whole tv shows box and Netflix because of this.
Works great loveee it
Great app!
Jellyfin is pretty good, but Chromecast doesn't seem to work when I'm accessing my server remotely.
No support for latin subtitle (romanian), subtitles have a question mark char for diacritics

This is such a great service, I got this app set up on my raspberry pi with relative ease, even as a complete novice to pi/Linux. The only issue I have is this app itself, Chromecasting is just plain broken. *Media controls routinely disappear *Jellyfin often forgets it's casting, so I just have something playing on Chromecast that I have no way of stopping without unplugging it *Google nest/Google home is not able to see anything being cast from jellyfin, so it just gets confused.

Installed on my Speed-A Android 10.0 TV Box. It connected to my server quickly. No native directional controls on the remote--I had to use a mouse. Once using a mouse, the cursor was invisible most of the time, which made navigating extremely difficult although the media played fine. I switched to Plex, and everything worked perfectly. It's a shame because I would prefer to support open-source software.
A far better alternative to emby. It does take a force close to get the chromecast to work but it's free.
Latests update ruined it. I can't cast to a chrome cast, have uninstalled and reinstalled, hard resets, different devices, nothing. Completely broken.

Has potential, but there are too many bugs to practical at the moment. App frequently requires a "force restart" to work properly, and there are constant problems with chromecasting. With some fixes it will be great.
Best media server hands down
Great open product. Streaming works well most of the time. I need to be able to switch servers more easily. It gets stuck trying on old server and won't allow change.
Will not launch on s21+
Overall great. The one huge drawback is it does not cast many video formats to Chromecast devices. I suppose it works have to transcode the stream to make that happen?
Overall very good but need to improve the subtitle downloading through the app.
Please improve the app. On old tablet when I hit play movie, it gets stuck on black screen and nothing happens. Also on my phone, on startup, it takes A LOT to load the app.
Thanks lo update
Streams flawlessly, both locally and remotely. Like the premium version of Plex but free! Love it :)
Great app with a fantastic interface.
Nothing plays on the app. On desktop and tv everything is fine but the mobile nothing happens.
Awesome app. Thanks!
Cannot pause nor rewind/go forward on the app :(

Update: Even better, it just doesn't connect to my Chromecast at all now. I didn't change a single thing. That's very cool. Constantly disconnects when trying to use it as a remote control. There is no intention to fix this as far as I know.
The best ready solution for dlna and web streaming at home. I don't have anything else to say. Keep going team !
Feature request: The ability to download more than just one thing per choosing of "download". Example: I want to download a whole TV season in one go.
Works really well.

Definitely better than its predecessors. The biggest issue I have with it is that it automatically identifies many folders as shows; there seems to be no way to prevent or even reverse this disruptive behavior.
Sadly Chromecast stopped to work on Vizio recently. Other apps still can cast to it, and it's jellyfin is working with other Chromecast devices.
Horribly buzzing audio, unusable.
This is great and exactly what I was looking for. Can you please make it available as a Chromecast app? That would be perfect.

Connects well to home server, good interface for regular users, but could use some UI refinement in the admin space. Moving buttons are a slight annoyance there from screen to screen. Playback is very good, especially given ISP upload rate restrictions for on-the-go home networking. Doesn't kill my old laptop-turned-server when transcoding with ffmpeg. Security is a work in progress, no TOTP support off the bat, but has LDAP support. This may be the biggest area that needs improvement.
The app doesn't perform well on my old device but pretty great otherwise.

Movies freeze and will not start. Movies will not start. Subtitles are always out of sync and no way to adjust. Don't waste your time with this as a media server it's garbage. Continue watching queue never clears.
Was working on my pixel 4a but when I upgrade to the pixel 5 it won't even launch
10 stars! Kudos to the developers.
Buggy, hard to use
App just can't play most of anything

For the 10.7 server update, its amazing. Just that my back (navbar/capacitive) button does not do anything in the app... Please fix that. I would very much appreciated it. I think it was done that way to avoid another bug that could not be fixed. Make the back button work again please.

If your looking for free software this one is decent. If your looking for good software go use emby. Many settings in jellyfin do absolutely nothing, bugs everywhere, android tv client apps look and perform terrible. Dev's dont seem to be fixing issues in a timely matter. You get what you pay for I guess. Good try though.
Constant stability issues just kill the experience. Bordering unusable on chromecast.
Freaking great
Fantastic mediaserver.live channel tedious and slow.but very good indeed not beat plex dou.
Loves it
Crashes on casting.
Great media player.
Awesome start! Could play iptv streams better...

First, For anyone with an Nginx proxy that can connect remotely via browser, but not via the app, add the base URL, found under Networking-advanced to the end of your URL. Search functionality is hit or miss, otherwise good.
no gdrive linking etc
Great media software. Love that I'm in control of my content. Great work by everyone in Jellyfin!
Works great!
Good!!!

Horrible user interface. Can only display 2 shows at a time on screen. I need to select a different letter to scroll through my library. Very unintuitive. Plex is terrible but it has a better user experience.
Crashes constantly when chromecasting
Peanutbutter-Jellyfin!
Great alternative to Plex.
Awesome client for your home server setup, much better than Plex or Emby, while still being open source and free :)

The app is awesome but please add HEVC 10bit support to direct play and support for PGS subtitles. The Fire TV app already supports both of these. On top of that Fire TV app supports chapter navigation but the android mobile app lacks that functionality.
Used to be able to chromecast but can not do that anymore.
Updated to 2.2.0 and app opens and crashes immediately
Sometimes the native player crashes, but web ayer works perfectly. Would love for downloads to work more like emby. Keep up the great work.
Doesn't work. After opening it once, it just opens as a blank white since.

V nice. If connection to server is lost, or if one stops and starts connection after exit, it doesn't let you resume the playlist (I usually have all songs on my server added with mix random). Also, if server has more audio streaming quality settings like stream in heaac or aac if upload speed is higher than the set audio limit of upload while having limited upload of server so it streams in specific upload speed max and while on Lan doesn't reencode
